data.text:
I‚Äôm hiring two Product Managers to work directly with me at as we scale Assort OS.

We‚Äôve successfully evolved from the first generative AI for healthcare call centers into a comprehensive clinical operating system. 

With the core infrastructure already built and operational, we are now in a high-growth phase: scaling the platform and launching a new suite of products to manage the entire patient journey.

The Role: You‚Äôll be joining a tiger team that executes with extreme speed and massive impact. This isn't just about maintaining features; it‚Äôs about 0-to-1 ownership as we expand our ecosystem to automate complex clinical and administrative workflows.

Why join us?
- Direct Impact: You will have the responsibility and ownership to build products that influence the care of millions of patients at scale.
- Velocity: We prioritize fast execution and zero bureaucracy.
- Founding Culture: You will work directly with me to shape the future of AI in healthcare.

If you are a builder who thrives in a high-autonomy environment and is ready to ship the next generation of healthcare infrastructure, let‚Äôs talk.

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - Specialty-specific voice AI to answer patient calls

data.text:
Thanks to a long bus ride this fall, I had the great pleasure of speaking with Dr. Titus Abraham for a couple hours. 

His passion for providing great human care is deeply authentic. 

This recent Healthcare IT article provides a glimpse into how Dr. Abraham and the entire team at Annapolis Internal Medicine LLC are using AI to improve patient access and make healthcare more proactive. 

In collaborative partnership with Assort Health, his team has:
- Booked 61% of flu shots through outbound agentic AI
- Decreased hold time by 75%
- Improved patient call ratings from 3.5/5 to 4.3/5

And importantly, clinicians (including Dr. Abraham himself) no longer need to deal with routine overflow calls, allowing them to treat patients with greater bandwidth. 

Dr. Abraham, thank you for sharing your wisdom and shaping the way AI can be used as a tool to improve our healthcare system. 

See link in comments. 

#ai #preventativemedicine #fluszn #voiceai

author.headline: AI Solutions | Assort Health

data.text:
It's energizing to see the real-world impact of our platform featured in Healthcare IT News. A huge thank you to the publication and especially to Dr. Titus Abraham of Annapolis Internal Medicine LLC for illustrating why we're building what we're building at Assort Health.

As Dr. Abraham shared: "We started with annual flu shot reminders ‚Äì we now can report that 61% of flu shot appointments were booked through agentic AI outreach ... The technology is now embedded in our daily operations. Staff depend on it to manage core administrative workflows, while patients interact with it for everything from scheduling to receiving reminders."

I'm incredibly proud of my team at Assort, and of what our partnership with Annapolis Internal Medicine is accomplishing.

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

article.title: Physician practice sees 'dramatic' difference with AI patient access platform | Healthcare IT News
article.subtitle: healthcareitnews.com

data.text:
Looking back on 2025, if I had to choose one thing that made a difference it was implementing Voice AI.
¬†
Last year, we integrated Assort Health‚Äôs voice AI into our scheduling workflow. Going into it, I was looking for efficiency‚Äîa software solution to handle the easy things like appointment confirmations and rescheduling.
¬†
What I found was a competitive advantage that exceeded my initial expectations. Technology is moving fast and this specific implementation was a standout. The partnership was highly valuable.

Where will we be one year from now? I'm excited to see where else AI can take us. What will be the biggest technology impact for physician practices in 2026? Personally, I think we'll see AI move from "handling the phones" to "ambient clinical support". Enabling doctors more time to focus on the patient rather than admin is what we all want. Let tech, where proven, handle the rest.
¬†
Happy to share the details of what I learned - feel free to direct message me.
¬†
Artificial Intelligence HealthTech Healthcare Assort Health

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

data.text:
Fellow LinkedIn tribe - Assort Health is now hiring for a Chief Medical Informatics Officer! 

Since launching, Assort has managed over 70M+ patient interactions for thousands of providers in 20 different specialties. Led by Jon Wang and Jeffery L., who combine both genuine healthcare empathy & Silicon Valley velocity, the team is well capitalized to go deep into building impactful partnership with top healthcare orgs.

The role will directly shape how they scale into large healthcare organizations and ensure their offerings resonate with clinical and operational leaders across the country. We're looking for a practicing or recently practicing physician with clinical informatics leadership experience, strong EMR fluency, and the commercial mindset to engage effectively with health system leaders. If this sounds like you, or someone you know, please reach out!

author.headline: Partner at Lightspeed Venture Partners

data.text:
In 2021, I left medical school with nothing but a few crazy ideas and a burning passion to improve patient access. 

Fast forward to today: We're honored to partner with incredible healthcare organizations that choose Assort Health to be the patient's first call‚Äînow powering over 70 million interactions for thousands of providers. 

In 2023, when we launched the first agentic AI to address specialty scheduling, we discovered that the hardest part wasn't the AI model. Rather, it was all the edge cases and nuances important to every patient's journey. Our partners use Assort to deliver personalized experiences that feel seamless to patients and are easily customized to provider-specific needs.  

I am proud of how far this team has come and even more energized by the next chapter, which will introduce new capabilities that enable us to understand patients more deeply than anyone else so we can best support their journey. 

Thank you, Forbes, for the recognition, and to our team, partners, and community for believing in our mission.

Read the full story below.

#HealthIT #AgenticAI #PatientExperience

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

data.text:
One of the fastest growing companies in agentic AI, Assort Health, is now #hiring for a Chief Medical Informatics Officer. This team is exceptional and of all the AI companies committed to making a difference for healthcare organizations, they're one of the few with strong validated outcomes on critical workflows...driving material cost savings and revenue gains.

Since launching the first #agentic #AI for specialty scheduling in 2023, Assort has managed over 70M+ patient interactions for thousands of providers in 20 different specialties. In the past few months, they‚Äôve raised over $100M to go extremely deep in building impactful partnerships with top #healthcare organizations.  

Having had the chance to work closely with them, I've been incredibly impressed by how intent they are on getting all the details right, specialty by specialty.  It's how they've achieved industry leading resolution rates, fully automating complex patient communications end-to-end.

This role will directly shape how they scale into large healthcare organizations and ensure their offerings resonate with clinical and operational leaders across the country. They‚Äôre looking for a practicing or recently practicing physician with clinical informatics experience, strong EMR fluency, and the commercial mindset to engage effectively with health system leaders.

If this sounds like you, or someone you know, please reach out!

author.headline: Board Partner, First Round Capital

data.text:
We‚Äôre honored to be named to the 2025 #Disruptors60 list by Greenfield Partners and featured on TechCrunch

This list celebrates startups using AI to create meaningful real-world change. For us, that means using technology to make high-quality healthcare simple, fast, and available to everyone. 

At Assort Health, we‚Äôre focused on solving healthcare access at scale‚Äînot by replacing people, but by combining clinical expertise with AI that helps care teams move faster and smarter. 

We‚Äôre grateful to our patients, partners, and team for making this work possible. 

See the full list: www.disruptors60.ai

Here's a paradox we're seeing play out: our AI rates 4.6/5 stars with patients. But 30-40% ask for a representative the moment they hear it's AI. 

This came up in my conversation with Elliott Wilson, MBA, PMP from Tech It to the Limit at #HLTH2025, and it's the tension that defines healthcare AI right now. 

After 50M patient interactions, the pattern is clear: the technology works. We've built systems that handle 1.2M edge cases‚Äîthe kind of specialty-specific scheduling logic that lives in binders and spreadsheets. The AI can navigate a 73-day global period for a PCP cortisone injection vs 85 days for Cigna. It doesn't forget. It doesn't burn out answering 150 calls a day. 

But trust isn't built on capability alone. What we've learned: the win isn't replacing the human. It's giving the front desk staff their humanity back. When they're not buried in binder rules and EHR screens during a call, they can actually listen to a struggling patient. The machine handles the mundane. The human handles the moment that matters. 

That's the shift. Not AI vs human. AI + human. 

What trust barriers are you seeing with clinical AI adoption?

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

data.text:
The phone is still healthcare‚Äôs front door. Right now it‚Äôs jammed.

Honored to share a deep-dive from Nikhil Krishnan at Out-Of-Pocket on what we‚Äôre building at Assort Health and why appointment scheduling is so hard. I‚Äôve followed Nikhil‚Äôs work for years, so this partnership and write-up mean a lot (thank you)!

A few highlights from his piece:

- Why scheduling breaks: matching reason and urgency to the right clinician, insurance rules, room/equipment needs, and multi-step visits like ‚Äúultrasound then OB,‚Äù all at once.
- What Assort does: agentic AI across voice, text, email, and web that triages, verifies insurance, schedules or escalates, and runs proactive outreach for waitlists and care gaps.
- Real results he cites: at OrthoIndy, 131% labor capacity increase, 38% labor cost reduction, and hold times cut from about an hour to roughly 30 seconds.


If you‚Äôre a practice leader or operator, this is a clear look under the hood. He also includes a reader perk and discount :)  

Full article link in the comments.

data.text:
This month, the Assort Health team traded dual monitors for ocean sunsets and fire dancers in Maui at our quarterly offsite.

We asked tough questions, recharged together, and ended one night with a luau under the stars and some surprisingly good hula attempts.

We‚Äôve now supported over 55 million patient interactions and grown our team 10x in the past year. We‚Äôre tackling some of the hardest and most meaningful problems in healthcare with the best team you could ask for.

I‚Äôm proud of what we‚Äôre building and grateful to do it with this group. We‚Äôre growing rapidly and looking for people to join our next luau photo!

The BoulderCentre for Orthopedics & Spine scheduling team found the perfect Halloween costume this year: Pearl, their AI scheduling assistant! 

Pearl helps BoulderCentre manage patient calls, appointments, and schedule changes quickly and efficiently. Seeing their team embrace her so enthusiastically reminds us why we built these tools in the first place: to free up staff from routine tasks so they can focus on patients. 

We love seeing our partners make room for creativity while using Assort Health tools to improve patient care. Thank you to the BoulderCentre team for bringing Pearl to life in such a fun way.

data.text:
Grateful to the Becker's Healthcare team for hosting such an insightful ASC conference and to Jessica Lam of Pacific Coast Anesthesia and Sherman Nam Tran MD of Spine & Sports Surgery Center for an engaging discussion on responsible innovation. 

At Assort Health, we‚Äôve learned that success with Agentic AI begins small‚Äîthrough transparent, auditable workflows that deliver measurable results. From automating administrative tasks to improving patient access, these early wins pave the way for lasting impact. 

I was proud to share our journey from being the first to fully schedule a healthcare appointment over the phone with Agentic AI to now managing millions of patient interactions each year‚Äîeach one a step toward simpler, more accessible healthcare.

data.text:
‚ÄúEvery physician practice and anyone in a medical practice knows it‚Äôs a seemingly endless queue of work. A tool that allows us to streamline and work efficiently is very much welcome, and that‚Äôs what Assort has been.‚Äù - Parinita Amin, MD, CEO of MDCS: Manhattan Dermatology and Cosmetic Surgery

Administrative overload is one of the biggest drivers of burnout in healthcare. By automating routine tasks like scheduling, call management, and follow-ups, Assort helps practices reclaim time for what matters most: patient care. 

We‚Äôre proud to partner with leaders like Dr. Amin who are using technology not just to improve access, but to create a better, more sustainable work environment for clinicians and staff.

article.title: Assort Health brings in $102M in 4 months to build out voice AI platform
article.subtitle: fiercehealthcare.com

resharedPost.text:
A patient‚Äôs journey shouldn‚Äôt start with ‚Äúplease hold.‚Äù Today, we‚Äôre announcing $102M to ensure it never happens again.

Ten years ago, Galym and I shook hands on our first venture‚Äîa small nonprofit with a big ambition to make healthcare investing more impactful. 

Today, we‚Äôre partnering again in a new way: a $76M Series B featured in Fortune and led by Lightspeed, which brings Assort Health's total funding to $102M. Galym is joining our board, and we‚Äôre thrilled to welcome Paul Ricci (founding CEO of Nuance Communications) as a board advisor. 

I left UCSF med school and Stanford AI research because I couldn‚Äôt accept that patients spend more time waiting on hold than with their doctors. Assort Health is making sure they never have to again.

The funding will be used to scale Assort OS: an all-in-one patient experience platform powered by agentic AI via voice, text, web, and email. It handles the most complex aspects of access, including scheduling, care navigation, lab coordination, prescription renewals, referrals, and more.

Before: endless hold times, wrong doctors, missed care.¬†
After: seamless scheduling, faster care, happier patients.

What this means in practice: 89% shorter wait times, 98% resolution rates, and patient ratings > 4.6/5 across hundreds of organizations‚Äîdriven by tens of millions of patient interactions at thousands of providers.

To every practice and health system tired of hold music: we‚Äôd love to show you a better way.

And if you‚Äôre excited to help us build the future of patient access, we‚Äôre hiring across growth, ops, and engineering.

With Assort, we‚Äôre ending the dreaded hold music‚Äîonce and for all!

Huge appreciation to all of our investors for this round: Lightspeed, Felicis, First Round Capital, Chemistry, Quiet Capital, A*, Liquid 2 Ventures, Apolo Ohno, Joe Montana.

Thank you to Allie Garfinkle for telling our story so thoughtfully. You can find it in the comments.

‚Äîand finally, to the Assort team, who are in the arena and shipping product for patients every day!

-------------------------------------
Thankful to our many supporters Brenton Fargnoli, M.D., Sebastian Duesterhoeft, Will Kohler, Bill Trenchard, Kristina Shen, Matt Humphrey, Mark Goldberg, Ethan Kurzweil, Amit Garg, Ian Feeney, Ali Javid, Bobby Green, M.D., Cameron Woodward, Aditya Khosla, Allison Pickens, Jay Desai, Andrew Tan, Jenny Friedman, Immad Akhund, Umesh Khanna, Kemuel Carey, Parinita Amin, Titus Abraham, Mandy McClellan, Roy Rosin, Emery Rosansky, and many more. We wouldn't be here without you!


#healthcare #AI #digitalhealth #patientexperience #SeriesB #startup #patientengagement

To every practice and health system tired of hold music: we‚Äôd love to show you a better way.

And if you‚Äôre excited to help us build the future of patient access, we‚Äôre hiring across growth, ops, and engineering.

With Assort, we‚Äôre ending the dreaded hold music‚Äîonce and for all!

Huge appreciation to all of our investors for this round: Lightspeed, Felicis, First Round Capital, Chemistry, Quiet Capital, A*, Liquid 2 Ventures, Apolo Ohno, Joe Montana.

Thank you to Allie Garfinkle for telling our story so thoughtfully. You can find it in the comments.

‚Äîand finally, to the Assort team, who are in the arena and shipping product for patients every day!

-------------------------------------

author.headline: AI Solutions

data.text:
We‚Äôre scaling Assort OS, the new front door to patient care.

Today we‚Äôre announcing a $76M Series B led by Lightspeed, bringing Assort Health‚Äôs total funding to $102M‚Äìfeatured in Fortune.

Assort OS is the most comprehensive patient experience platform powered by specialty‚Äëspecific agentic AI: agents that act on behalf of practices across voice, text, web, and email to serve patients in real time.

Impact so far:
üìà  40M+ patient interactions across thousands of providers
‚åõ  89% shorter wait times
üëç  98% resolution rates
ü§©  PSAT above 94%
‚ûñ  Before: 35 minutes on hold, transfers, wrong specialists.
‚úÖ  After: zero hold time, the right visit, faster care.

How we‚Äôll use the capital:
üí™  Strengthen reliability, safety, and integrations across Assort OS
üß†  Deepen voice and multi‚Äëchannel agents that complete tasks end‚Äëto‚Äëend
ü§ù  Build a world‚Äëclass team across growth, ops, and engineering to serve tens of millions more patients

To the Assort team: thank you. Your relentless execution, compassion for patients, and obsession with our partners and quality made this round possible.

We‚Äôre hiring! If you‚Äôre ready to fix patient access with us, DM me. üôå 

Huge thanks to our supporters: Lightspeed, Felicis, First Round Capital, Chemistry, A*, Paul Ricci, Liquid 2 Ventures , Quiet Capital, Apolo Ohno, Joe Montana, Galym Imanbayev, MD, Brenton Fargnoli, M.D., Sebastian Duesterhoeft, Will Kohler, Bill Trenchard, Kristina Shen, Matt Humphrey, William Chmelar, Mark Goldberg, Ethan Kurzweil, Amit Garg, Tau Ventures, Ian Feeney, Bobby Green, M.D., Aditya Khosla, Allison Pickens, Jay Desai, Jenny Friedman, Immad Akhund, Ashwin Sreenivas, Umesh Khanna, Kemuel Carey, Parinita Amin, Mandy McClellan, Roy Rosin, Emery Rosansky, Titus Abraham, and many many more. And a big thank you to Allie Garfinkle for capturing our story, linked in the comments.

data.text:
The patient care journey is broken and that's what we're on a mission to solve for at Assort Health. Thank you to Lightspeed for leading our Series B round to enable our continued scale and growth for the next phase of this company's trajectory. 

As someone who has personally been affected by navigating the broken healthcare ecosystem with long hold times, delays to care and financial burden, I'm incredibly proud to be apart of this mission-driven team to increase access to patient care through our agentic technology. 

Link in comments for press release.

Jon Wang Jeffery L. Ray Mathew Lauren Chioma (Ogbogu) Knight Leo Sundstrom Arman Yekta Manning Edson Robbie Harding Gabriel Eliasson Aaron Schatz Bear Barnes Greg Rattray Andrew J. Garcia

author.headline: GTM @ Assort Health | Partnerships & AI Strategy

resharedPost.text:
2,090 calls that would have otherwise gone unanswered are now handled.

That‚Äôs what Barrington Orthopedic Specialists unlocked when they found a way to serve patients outside of standard office hours, without adding a single FTE.

Before Assort, 30‚Äì40% of calls never made it through. That‚Äôs about 2,090 patients a month, many of whom wait on hold for 30 minutes or more before giving up. And in a clinic that sees 60 patients a day, a single mis-scheduled appointment could throw everything off.

With Assort Health‚Äôs Voice AI agent integrated directly into their EMR, patients can now book, reschedule, or cancel appointments at any time, even outside of business hours. At the same time, complex cases are routed to the appropriate staff. The AI applies Barrington‚Äôs detailed scheduling rules every time, so the right patient gets the correct slot with the right provider.

Impact:

- $9,900/month in additional value from after-hours call management
- 36 more after-hours appointments booked each month
- 2,090 calls that would have been missed are now answered
- Wait times reduced from 30+ minutes to under 5 minutes

When the phones don‚Äôt stop ringing, the right technology can mean the difference between missed care and a booked appointment.

author.headline: GTM @ Assort Health | Partnerships & AI Strategy

data.text:
‚ÄúI was so excited to come to work this morning I ran over!‚Äù ‚Äì one of our amazing reps.

We had the privilege of hosting Leandra Fishman , CRO at Proof (formerly CRO at Intercom and Apollo.io, and SVP at Twilio), at Assort‚Äôs quarterly GTM team dinner.

Leandra generously shared her career journey and dropped so much wisdom on sales, personal growth, and leadership. We left the evening both inspired and energized.

Assort‚Äôs team is scaling quickly as we work to serve tens of millions of patients this year. We‚Äôre looking for great people across engineering, operations, and GTM to grow with us‚Äîand to join in on these unforgettable dinners.

Special shoutout to our friends from Felicis Aydin and Astasia for setting us up at Quince for a top tier dinner experience!

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

data.text:
This week I start a new chapter with Assort Health!

Why? In 2025, the average wait to see a physician in the U.S. is 31 days (up 20% since 2022). ¬†Nearly half of clinicians report burnout, which contributes to limited patient access, increased operational costs, and reduced efficiency across health systems.

Throughout my career, I‚Äôve worked with businesses to help them grow and scale. What makes this next adventure special is the chance to apply that same focus on growth and efficiency to healthcare, where the outcomes are measured not only in financial returns, but in optimized patient access which lead to healthier lives.

Assort is tackling these problems with agentic solutions that automate routine workflows, reduce administrative friction, and extend provider capacity. This creates a measurable impact through stronger patient access, improved clinician productivity, and lower system-wide cost of ownership.

author.headline: AI Solutions Director @ Assort Health

data.text:
Had a great session at the National Association of Community Health Centers (NACHC) expo here in Chicago (August 17‚Äì19).

One highlight today was the panel¬†‚ÄúFor CEOS Only: Enter, Apply, and/or Accept At Your Own Risk‚Äù.¬†The discussion was candid, practical, and filled with advice for leaders:

- ‚ÄúStay rooted. Know your values, purpose, and mission.‚Äù¬†‚Äì¬†Dr. Jessica Boyd, CEO, MD, MPH (CINQCARE)

- ‚ÄúTeam is essential‚Äîit will take you down with the wrong people.‚Äù¬†‚Äì¬†Dr. Shantelle R. Simpson, EdD, MSN, RN, CEO, EdD, MSN, RN, (Appalachian Mountain Health)

- ‚ÄúDuring the recruitment process, be clear on roles and responsibilities between the CEO and the board.‚Äù¬†‚Äì¬†Craig Glover, Ed.D., FACHE, FACMPE, CHCEF, CEO, (FamilyCare Health Centers, WV)

- ‚ÄúStorytelling and communication are key jobs as you evolve.‚Äù¬†‚Äì¬†Rashad Collins, CEO, MS (Neighborcare Health)

- ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs lonely at the top. Dig deep to motivate yourself and stay thoughtful and motivated.‚Äù¬†‚Äì¬†David B. Vliet, MBA, CEO, (VlietHealth LLC)

- ‚ÄúStay centered. So many things will be changing, and you need to stay grounded.‚Äù¬†‚Äì¬†Dr. Alecia Cyprian, CEO, PhD, (Southeast Community Health Systems)

Grateful to National Association of Community Health Centers (NACHC) for convening this important discussion and to these leaders for sharing their perspectives on the future of community health.

companyMentions.name: National Association of Community Health Centers (NACHC)
National Association of Community Health Centers (NACHC)

data.text:
Honored to have Joe Montana attending the Assort Health Ascend customer summit this year.

Widely regarded as one of the greatest quarterbacks of all time, Joe led the San Francisco 49ers to four Super Bowl championships and earned a reputation for calm under pressure, precision in execution, and relentless leadership.

His legacy isn‚Äôt just about winning, it‚Äôs about consistency, teamwork, and delivering when it matters most.

In healthcare, we know what pressure feels like. From staffing challenges to shifting technology and rising patient expectations, leading through uncertainty is part of the job.

Joe‚Äôs story resonates because it‚Äôs not just about talent; it‚Äôs about how you stay composed, make smart decisions, and lift those around you when the stakes are highest.

Join us in welcoming him to our customer summit for Napa, September 19-21! An intimate gathering for bold builders, operators, and champions from the clinics, call centers, and care teams.

companyMentions.name: National Association of Community Health Centers (NACHC)

data.text:
Assort Health is heading to the USWHA Fall Conference 2025, September 4‚Äì6! 

We can't wait to join leaders and innovators at this year's U.S. Women's Health Alliance Fall Conference to share ideas, swap insights, and explore the future of women's healthcare.

Our Voice AI agent is helping women's health practices streamline patient communication, improve access, and free up staff capacity, empowering care teams to focus on what matters most: their patients. 

In OB/GYN clinics, our technology answers 19% more calls daily, reducing workload by the equivalent of 57% of the clinic's FTE headcount, and maintains a 4.4/5 patient satisfaction score, results we'll be showcasing live at USWHA alongside partners like Chesapeake Regional Healthcare Women's Care, Women's Health Arizona, and CATALYST MEDICAL GROUP, PLLC 

Events like the USWHA conference are a chance to reflect on our progress, exchange ideas with peers, and explore how technology can continue to improve healthcare delivery.

Reach out if you'll be around and would like to connect!

#USWHA #WomensHealth #HealthcareInnovation #VoiceAI #AssortHealth

We are grateful to share that Assort Health was named to Forbes‚Äô Next Billion-Dollar Startups 2025 list.

This is a team win, across engineering, operations, marketing, and sales. Thank you to our customers and partners for the trust and feedback that push us to get better.

Our mission is straightforward: to make exceptional healthcare accessible anytime, anywhere, for anyone, so every patient can get the care they need, when they need it, without barriers.

Thank you to Forbes for featuring us and thanks to everyone who‚Äôs been with us on the journey.

Onward. üöÄ

I‚Äôm thrilled to announce that I‚Äôm starting a new position as Director, Enterprise AI Solutions at Assort Health! 

Excited to work directly with Ray Mathew and Jon Wang to scale Assort's AI-Driven technology to as many patients as possible and increase access to care!!

Assort Health was just announced this morning on Forbes' Next Billion Dollar Start Up in 2025. Link in comments
